title: Religion Births Rationality, Decadence and the Resurrection of Christianity
description:
Does religion birth the rationality of a culture? I heard an idea like this at the Bellflower meetup and saw something like it in Ross Douthat's The Decadent Society. I start to dig into that book. Touch on Jordan Peterson, Star Trek, Oneida, Kinfolk and then GK Chesterton's The Everlasting man.

Douthat's Decadent Society https://amzn.to/2wVuHRk
Tom Holland Dominion https://amzn.to/3bL2rjn
https://albertmohler.com/thinking-in-public
The Feminist Case for Jordan Peterson https://albertmohler.com/thinking-in-public
Rebel Wisdom Jordan Peterson Interview https://youtu.be/husJZ2THQdU
Kinfolk Vanity Fair https://www.vanityfair.com/style/2020/03/how-kinfolk-magazine-defined-the-millennial-aesthetic-and-unraveled-behind-the-scenes
Oneida Free Love and a Well Set Table https://amzn.to/3azeBLZ
GK Chesterton the Everlasting Man https://amzn.to/3azTR6O
Syd Hielema Conversation https://youtu.be/IfBfG2z4Vag
Woodstock Documentary Trailer https://youtu.be/asDTFjApJ2c (on Netflix)
Fyre Festival Netflix Documentary Trailer https://youtu.be/uZ0KNVU2fV0
